page.title: 05St.Oswald's Church.
page.content: Described as the oldest church in the North-East corner of the old East Riding of Yorkshire,St.Oswalds took 50 years to build.Its massive square tower topped by a gold plated fish weather vane,stands on the cliff top. The church is surrounded by a graveyard with many old tombstones bearing interesting inscriptions.At one time the West end of the church was cobbled and sheep from a nearby farm were allowed to eat the grass that grew between the stones.In 1908 a fire destroyed the organ and pent of the roof.Next to the modern, carved altar is the old stone one which is believed to contain some relics it was found in the floor near the chancel door in 1925. The stone effigy in the South hall is probably the memorial of a boy bishop who died in office.
